column4: is it possible, through linux, to edit files on your windows mounted drives
because linux doesn't have good support for writing to NTFS
windows on one partition and linux on another
linux can read ntfs fine, but not write, whereas windows can't do anything with linux formats
consider making a third partition formatted as FAT32..
and use it for things you need to have on both
or format my 2nd hard drive .. my multimedia hard drive to be fat32
and either way, you can read the windows stuff with linux
so if you need to just move stuff from windows to linux, it'd be fine
no i wanna download stuff using linux too like music/movies but it obv cant save so that i can access it thru win
